name: Red Panda
description: The Red Panda is a small mammal with reddish fur and a bushy tail, known for its arboreal habits.
spread_note: Found in the eastern Himalayas and southern China.
food_note: Spends much of its time in trees, foraging at dusk.
proportions: Length: 50-65 cm, tail: 30-50 cm, weight: 3-6 kg.
reproduction: Gestation about 4.5 months, litters of 1-4 cubs.
attractions: Popular in zoos for their adorable appearance and playful behavior.
projects_note: Endangered due to habitat loss; conservation programs are active.
breeding: Commonly bred in captivity for conservation.
